clinical_study.brief_title: High Working Memory Load to Reduce Internet Gaming Disorder (IGD) Cravings
clinical_study.official_title: High Working Memory Load to Reduce IGD Cravings: N-Back Task

brief_summary.textblock: To test whether high working memory load can effectively reduce the craving for IGD.

detailed_description.textblock: This project is to use 1-back task and 3-back task to reduce the craving of internet gamers. To test whether high working memory load can effectively reduce the craving for IGD. This project will be conducted in Beijing, China, based on a large sample of internet gamers.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 0-1 minutes before each set of cue
primary_outcome.description: The craving of internet gamers is measured by a single item Visual Analogue Scale with 1 to 7 likert score.

primary_outcome.measure: The craving of internet gamers after cue
primary_outcome.description: The craving of internet gamers is measured by a single item Visual Analogue Scale with 1 to 7 likert score.

primary_outcome.measure: The craving of internet gamers after tasks
primary_outcome.time_frame: 0-1 minutes after finishing each block of tasks
primary_outcome.description: The craving of internet gamers is measured by a single item Visual Analogue Scale with 1 to 7 likert score.

arm_group.arm_group_label: High Working memory load: n-back task
arm_group.description: During the intervention, each participant of this group will finish the 3-back task.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Low Working memory load: n-back task
arm_group.description: During the intervention, each participant of this group will finish the 1-back task.

intervention.description: All participants will be asked to finish the 3-back task and the 1-back task. The 3-back task and the 1-back task will be carried out at intervals to avoid the influence between different tasks. The sequence of the 3-back task and the 1-back task will be counterbalanced across participants.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The scores of the 9 items of The Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fifth Edition(DSM-5) recommended diagnosis for Internet gaming disorder ≥ 5.
- Engagement in popular Internet games (e.g. Arena of Valor, League of Legends and Player Unknown's Battle Grounds) for over 20 hours per week for a minimum of 12 months.
- The scores of theYoung-Internet Addiction Test(Y-IAT) ≥ 50
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current or history of use of illegal substances and gambling;
- Current or history of psychiatric or neurological illness;
- Current use of psychotropic medications.
